utterance.speaker: Daisy
utterance.content: What's the difference between a sea lion and a seal?

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: What's that, baby?

utterance.speaker: Daisy
utterance.content: What's the difference between a sea lion and a seal?

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Um, seals tell the truth, but a sea lion's always lyin'?

utterance.speaker: Daisy
utterance.content: A sea lion has ears.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Yeah, that's right. I forgot.

utterance.speaker: Daisy
utterance.content: I'll show you when we get to the zoo. Can we have pizza tonight?

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: I'm not gonna be here, Daisy. I'm-I'm going back on the road, remember?

utterance.speaker: Daisy
utterance.content: You've only been here for two days.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: I'll be back in three weeks this time.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Somebody help her!

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: She's having a seizure!

utterance.speaker: Man 2
utterance.content: On the track?

utterance.speaker: Man 3
utterance.content: Yeah, there's a lady down there.

utterance.speaker: Daisy
utterance.content: Daddy, come back! Daddy!

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Hey. Lady, are you okay? Come on, come on, hey, wake up! Come on! Get up! Hey! Come on. Help me! Somebody help me! Come on!

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Aah!

utterance.speaker: Daisy
utterance.content: Daddy!

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Hey, man, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Yeah, I think so.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: She's epileptic. Come on, let's get you up. You got her?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Yeah, we got her.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Hey, sweetie, I'm okay.

utterance.speaker: Daisy
utterance.content: Daddy?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You're right. EKG is more interesting than loss of consciousness, so—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: God, she's still talking. Make it stop.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: The guy did a wonderful thing. Can't we just take that at face value?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You are adorable. Heroism does exist.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: What about the guy who landed the plane in the Hudson?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: News flash — that guy was already on the plane. For all we know, he would have killed everyone else on board if it increased his chances. Faced with almost certain death, a normal person rides the pine.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: What about firefighters?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The guys who undergo months of training to deny their own instincts for self-preservation?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And the patient isn't a firefighter. He plays a bass in a band.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: So humanity is apathetic and self-serving?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I was mugged once. When I saw the gun, my legs went out.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I always thought it was fight or flight. Didn't know it was fight or flight or faint.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Laugh all you want. The other hundred people stayed on that platform. That's a normal response to danger.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The coward has spoken. Our patient's problem is neurological. Sympathetic stimulation — stress to the brain triggers a response in the heart. Go forth and look for masses in Clark Kent's limbic system.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Seems like you're getting a bit of attention.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Everyone keeps going out of their way asking me if I need anything. It's kind of nice.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: So what happened out there?

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: I don't really remember. It's just images, like flashes. I kind of went on autopilot. My memory doesn't go back into real time until I was in the ambulance.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I read that's pretty common for people in life-or-death situations.

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: Jack.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Honey. Uh, this is my wife, Eva.

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm fine. They're just doing some tests. How's Daisy?

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: She's not so good, actually. She watched her father jump in front of a train. Ugh. She's still shaking. She can't stop crying. Why would you do that to her?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He saved a woman's life.

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: He could have died. Did you even think about your family?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need your advice. Dinner with your mom on Thursday.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What? I can't. It's your birthday.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I need your advice. This film festival.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. I'm definitely coming.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But Thursday is Cuddy's birthday, and her mom's coming down — it's a whole dinner thing. And I thought, maybe if you see her, you could mention how upset you've been.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You have to go. Your girlfriend's birthday? It's not even a question.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She has one every year. How often do you break up with the love of your life? Okay, for you, it's more often than most, but still…

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm a big boy. I think I'll survive.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey. Am I imagining things, or did I see a billboard with your face on it on my way home tonight?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Oh, was my whole face there? 'Cause I just saw the nose.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: They did. I have no idea how it ended up just me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, you are pretty cute.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're flirting with me?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don't see anyone else in the room. What?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I don't know. Things have been a little tense around here since that whole online-boyfriend thing.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No, you're the one with feelings for someone else.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You're still my husband. I still love you. And I want things to be okay between us. Also, you're a famous model now. That's pretty cool… sexy, even.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: So I advance through the carotid bifurcation…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Are you asking?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Yes, I'm asking. I've only read how to do it. Practice is different than theory. Just tell me how to do it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're going to inject dye just past the takeoff for the optic artery.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Right. Now?

utterance.speaker: Chases
utterance.content: His B.P.'s going up. The procedure's stressing his body.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Well, what do I do?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hold on a minute. Just give him a chance to regain equilibrium. B.P.'s up, heart rate's 180.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: W-what should I do?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So we finally know what Taub would look like if he were life-size.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Can we go back to the office now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You kidding? We got a differential to run. . Cardiac arrhythmia.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That poster got me laid when I got home last night, so do your worst.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Arrhythmia proves I was right. Jack's problem is his heart, not his brain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So when you're not on a billboard, you sleep with nurses. But when you are, you sleep with your wife. I think you got that backwards.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That's my elbow in the corner. What's your wife doing later?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Huh. They chose you and cut out Chase?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Apparently, marketing thinks my face is the most trustworthy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: For real?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Both of our patients' cardiac incidents happened after physical stress. I'm guessing vasovagal syncope?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Buzzkill.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Vasovagal syncope would manifest at a much younger age. Could be drugs.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Tox screen was clean.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What about autonomic nervous system dysfunction? It could cause arrhythmia and fainting.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Inappropriate? I mean, 'cause of the Jew thing? Autonomic nervous system dysfunction — I like it. Let's biopsy his pituitary gland.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Adrenal venous sampling makes more sense and is a less invasive procedure… which you don't care about, because you just want to check the pituitary, because you still think there's something wrong with the guy's brain?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can't fool you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He has no other symptoms for pituitary disease. We can't stick a needle in his brain because you don't believe in heroism.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine, do it your way. You'll waste half a day, but I'm sure he's in no hurry to get better.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The autonomic nervous system controls involuntary actions, like your heartbeat. If we're right, it's manageable, but will progress.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I didn't know you knew Dr. Taub.

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: I don't.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You saw the ads.

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: Look, no offense, but you were wrong yesterday. And they wouldn't have made him the face of the hospital if he weren't really good, right?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I forgot. You guys talk. Look, no offense to either of you, but dinner with your mom? Come on, I-I'd have to act like a decent human being , and you know what a strain that puts on me. And you , ever since you broke up with Sam, you've done nothing but mope and whine. It's an unbelievable bummer.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And just what is so exciting you have to blow off both of us to do it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I just want to sit on my couch in my underwear, drink scotch, and watch The Real Housewives of New Jersey… by myself. I just want one night off. Is that so much to ask?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You have to choose one of us.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I do not whine.

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: Jack's not exactly the hero type. He started this band in college. They gig around the country, looking for their big break. It's been 16 years.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That must be hard on you and Daisy.

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: It's like I'm a single parent. I love him so much. But I'm at the end of my rope.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What Jack did yesterday was so incredible, our boss assumed his illness had something to do with his behavior. But if that's not the case, there's more to him than you think.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You think Taub really comes across as the most trustworthy doctor here?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They cut me out.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're a pretty boy. Works well with the ladies, not so much with the patients. No one wants an underwear model performing their splenectomy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well, I notice they weren't exactly knocking down your door looking for Dr. Trustworthy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That's 'cause I'm black. Cortisol levels look normal. We were wrong.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Which House will interpret as him being right. He's gonna make us biopsy the pituitary gland.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You seem pretty calm for a guy who's surrounded by racists.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: 80% of the Princeton population is white. Some are racist. Some aren't. White works with both demographics.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So race is your excuse, not the fact that you usually look like you're about to punch someone in the face? We're good.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: O2 sats are dropping.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's not breathing. Suction.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sats are coming back.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Mucus plug. That's weird.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Fluid in the lungs.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Pneumonitis? That doesn't fit with anyone's theory.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Our tests finally rule out the brain. That leaves the heart and the lungs.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Pneumonitis can be caused by bacteria, parasite, some kind of an obstruction.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who was the girl on the tracks?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: News story said her name was Chloe Jeffries. Why does that matter?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 'Cause there's another reason besides being sick that he'd risk his life for a stranger. She's not a stranger. The damsel in distress is an epileptic. So we assumed she was having an epileptic seizure, but what if she wasn't? What if she's sick too?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Jack is away a lot on tour. What happens on the road stays on the road.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: The most likely cause of pneumonitis is infection. Shouldn't we be getting a sputum culture?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's no significant elevation of white blood cell count. This is more like toxic exposure.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's got a point.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Why is your assumption of his guilt more valid than my assumption of his selflessness?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because my assumption is backed up by millions of men, and Taub, who've cheated on their wives. Find the girl and the love nest. Every hero has his Kryptonite.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So we're breaking into this girl's apartment because House thinks that two people, standing 30 feet apart on a subway platform have to be lovers.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: God, you're a drag today. Let me guess. Back to fighting with the wife?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. We had sex again last night… twice… and again this morning.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Aw.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Rachel hasn't wanted this much intimacy in a long time. I don't think it's me she's hot for. It's this Internet guy. She's just happy, and that's turning her on.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So she's not cheating on you, and you're getting all the action you can handle. I don't see the downside. What was Jack's band called?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Suicide… something.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: EKG's unremarkable, thyroid, liver, and kidney function seems fine. You're perfectly healthy.

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: I wish that you would take a second look. I'm tired all the time, and when it's cold, I get this weird pain in my shoulder.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have a pain in my leg. You don't hear me complaining… Except for just now.

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: How do doctors get this idea you're better than everyone else?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Probably all that pulling people back from the brink of death. It's just a guess.

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: My own daughter is a doctor. She makes a hobby of dismissing my concerns.

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: Did she tell you to say that?

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: That's hard to believe, since you're currently shtupping her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We have a situation.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Roach bombs, where?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: In Chloe's apartment.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Who's Chloe?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Uh, look, we don't care about your personal life. We're not gonna tell your wife.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: I honestly have no idea what you're talking about.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Guess who showed up looking for Jack.

utterance.speaker: Chloe
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: You okay? The E.M.T. said you'd gone to another hospital.

utterance.speaker: Chloe
utterance.content: They help me overnight for observation. I'm fine. I had to come here to… I don't know why you did it, but thank you.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: You're welcome.

utterance.speaker: Chloe
utterance.content: I should have brought flowers or something. You're like my guardian angel.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: No. I'm just a guy in a band.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Maybe you've heard of them? Suicide Season?

utterance.speaker: Chloe
utterance.content: One of my nurses gave me the CD. I haven't had a chance to listen to it yet, but I have a feeling I'm going to be your biggest fan.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Getting a sputum culture. They obviously don't know each other, so it's not toxic exposure. Just leaves my theory — infection. If you could just cough up a sample, we can, uh, test for pathogens.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Um… Sorry, um… sorry, nothing — there's nothing coming up.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Well, maybe I can help you.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Aah! Ohh! It hurts!

utterance.speaker: Chloe
utterance.content: What's the matter?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: "When I saw her lying there, I thought, "'I can't just stand here and let her die. She has her whole life to live.'"

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He didn't jump because he was sick or because he knew that girl. Even you have to admit that now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes, but that doesn't make him a hero. It makes him an idiot. The only reason that headline doesn't say "moron crushed by train" is luck.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Next headline is gonna be "moron goes undiagnosed because doctors won't talk about his ear pain."

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Ear pain fits with my theory. Jack has an infection that's spread to his mastoid.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great. We'll confirm that in a week, when your secret cultures have sprouted.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Am I in trouble?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I only get mad when you waste my time. Couldn't care less about yours. But let me know when they come back negative, and I'll mock you.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You have a better idea?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope, so I'm gonna pick one at random. Acoustic neuroma.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: A tumor in the ear — makes sense. And if it's putting pressure on the breathing centers in his brain, explains the lungs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The lungs explain the heart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Evoked auditory potential test. This counts as my time.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You guys got this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have been going out of my way to be nice to old Jewish ladies for months now on the off chance one of them could be your mom. You couldn't have mentioned she's a shiksa?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She converted when she married my dad.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You see, now is too late.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm not blaming you for this. She's the one who ambushed you to find out what you were like, because I "never tell her anything."

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'd have to agree with her on that one. Anyway, I obviously can't come to dinner now.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Obviously?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, she's crazy, and she hates me.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House… I need you to come to that dinner for two hours, keep your mouth shut, and behave like an adult. Yes, you will be in hell, but I will feel better having you there. That is what a relationship is. We average our misery.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That was… unexpected.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I'm having a good day. I finally resolved that thing with my sister.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What thing?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, we had the worst fight over whether it's time to put Dad in that facility. Been sick over it for weeks.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You never mentioned anything about your sister.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I actually talked a lot about it with Phil.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It's fine now. I-it's no big deal.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Are you in love with him?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I've never met him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Waves one and three normal at 70 decibels.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It's been 37 minutes, and everything is normal. House is wrong again. He doesn't have a tumor.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House doesn't usually accept "we gave up halfway" as an answer.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: If I could get fluid closer to the sources of infection, I could get better cultures, prove my theory. I'm gonna set up for an ear drainage and thoracentesis. I'll only be wasting my time.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's a student. Somebody's got to go with her.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: I saved that girl. I did that.

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: And I'm really proud of you.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: This whole thing has made me wonder… if things could be different. I have spent so much time away from you.

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: Yeah, well, you love your music.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: But it's not just that. I think that I have been… afraid… that I would screw things up, that I couldn't be the man you and Daisy needed me to be. But maybe I'm better than that. Hmm? I am going to quit the band.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Uh-oh.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Hey, how's the ear pain?

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: It's better with the drugs, but it still really hurts.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We are going to take some fluid samples from your ear and your lung. Can you get up? Lean forward. Lean on this. Okay, this is Lidocaine. It'll numb you up.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Okay. This is weird.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: What-what's the matter?

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: The pain in my ear is gone.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Gone? Completely?

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Yeah, when you stuck me in the back. What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Okay, I'm just cutting that for you. Yum yum.

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: Is… is she going to eat anything else or just the cheese and crackers?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She's going through a picky phase — it won't kill her.

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: You're her mother. All I know is, when you and your sister were growing up, you ate what we ate. No excuses.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Would you pass the salt?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She had eggs this morning, and lots of fruit.

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: Ah. That explains it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Explains what?

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: She was a little vilder chaiah in the park this afternoon. She wouldn't listen to anything I said. Must have been all the sugar.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Actually, the whole sugar-makes-kids-hyperactive thing is a myth. It's a study.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I have to get this. Tell me you need me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Jack doesn't have cancer.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Masters stuck him in the back with Lidocaine, and his ear pain went away.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We don't need you here. We just need to figure out why this guy's body thinks his ear is on his back.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because his ear used to be something else. When you're a fetus, your cells are close together. When you grow, they spread out and specialize. Sometimes the body screws up, and they keep the old area codes, report to the same pain centers.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Referred pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Looks and brains. When you stuck him in the back, you cut off communication with the pain centers in his spinal cord. So we just need to figure out where the message is actually coming from. What about his thyroid?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hyperthyroidism would explain all his symptoms.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or it could be his liver.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Good. We'll take a look at both. If it’s spreading to—

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: For the record, referred pain does not rule out infection—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Were you like this when you were working for your math degree? If Euclid had been a guest lecturer, would you have been the kid sitting in the front row going, "actually, you haven't proven the Pythagorean Theorem"? Hello?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: All right. Mom…

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: Thank you, sweetie. So say you two got married, would you convert to Judaism?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm an atheist.

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: Honey, half the Jews I know are atheists. It's about community.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House isn't that big on community.

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: And why do you call him "House"? The man's name is Greg. It makes it seem like you're not serious. I'm just trying to help you think about the future. You're-you're a certain age now. The parade of boyfriends can't be as amusing as it was. You need to settle down, like your sister.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Settling down isn't all it's cracked up to be. Next week is Sam's birthday. I was gonna take her to the Poconos and—

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: That's very sad. Perhaps not the best choice of topic for a festive occasion. I just don't want Rachel growing up thinking you're a slut.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Did you… sedate my mother?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kicked in just in time. She'll wake up in a couple of hours, be good as new. Think of it as my birthday gift to you. You told me to keep my mouth shut. It's the only way I had a chance.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry. I honestly thought you'd be worse. That was my gift to myself.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I take it Jack's thyroid levels are normal.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Foreman is doing a liver biopsy now.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: What's up with you?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Nothing. I'm peachy.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Have you even had sex?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We're not talking about me. We're talking about you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No, you're talking about puppies, and I'm not listening. [Masters looks at Taub sympathetically.) She wants to do it all the time, but it has nothing to do with me. I'm just a piece of meat.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Well, she likes someone else, and you've slept with other people. Uh, why are you still together?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I love her. We've been together for 22 years. I've never loved anybody else. I don't know how to… not be with her.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: So you're never gonna cheat again.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Well, that seems kind of selfish, doesn't it? Foreman found diffuse inflammation in Jack's liver. Looks like autoimmune hepatitis… Starting him on steroids.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: What's this note? Does that sound like an "A"? Remember, I put my finger like this without this doohickey on it, it's an "F." See?

utterance.speaker: Daisy
utterance.content: Hmm… Can we read a book instead?

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: Yes, we — Jack?

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: Jack! Help him!

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Come on. Come on.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He seized three times last night. We got him stabilized, but barely.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If there was nothing wrong with his brain before, there sure is now.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Any particular reason we need to be looking at the patient?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes. Cuddy's mom is in my office, and she looks mad.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What did you do?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Our patient also developed a raging fever overnight. That means Masters was right all along. This is an infection.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Should we give you a minute to gloat?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We still don't know what kind of infection — could be bacterial, viral, fungal. Until the cultures—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You are the worst gloater ever.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Her starting those cultures when she did means we're 24 hours closer to the answer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: "We're sorry your husband croaked, but at least we were 24 hours closer to the answer." Let's narrow it down, shall we?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Four days ago, the guy was facedown in the subway. God only knows what's in that sludge. Toxic fumes make him pass out — rat pee does the rest.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If it's leptospirosis, it's the fastest-moving case in history.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Leptospirosis can turn into meningitis.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I can't confirm any of this yet, and we don't have time to choose wrong.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It fits, and since it's the only idea on the table, I say it's a winner. Start him on doxycycline. No, wait. I'll do it. You guys have to go back to the office, tell me when bubbie's gone.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: You a doctor?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sure. You're on new meds. Go back to sleep.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Am I gonna die?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, I hope not, 'cause then I'd have to go back to my office. Of course, if you do kick it, then you get to be famous for another two, maybe three weeks.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: They're saying I'm a hero?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, but, you know, in a few days, a panda bear will give birth to triplets, and we'll all move on. Oh, I'm sorry. You actually believe that you are a hero. Should get yourself some tights and a cape, run around Gotham pulling babies out of burning buildings. Maybe you'll keep getting lucky. You're still the same guy you were last week.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Hey, um… How long are you gonna sit there?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Could be hours.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Hiding behind a sick guy… That's heroic.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I can explain. Sometimes I mix up my medications.

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: I don't need you to explain anything. I think we both know that… I owe you an apology.

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: I don't even remember going to bed last night. I must have had too much to drink. I do know I can be difficult.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were a little bitchy.

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: In the clinic, you were a complete schmendrick, but once you knew I was Lisa's mother, you held your tongue. That's because you love her. I still think you're a pain in the ass with a God complex, and I'll kill you if you hurt her, but I'm glad she has you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We don't have to hug now, do we?

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: What do you think? I've got a train to catch.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I thought you were staying till Sunday.

utterance.speaker: Arlene
utterance.content: I'm coming down with a cold. Every time I stay with Lisa or her sister, one of those rug rats gets me sick. Children are awful.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did she have a rash recently?

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: No. What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What is she doing here anyway? It's the middle of the morning. Shouldn't she be in school?

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: I'm keeping her out for a few days. There's been a little outbreak—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Chicken pox. Sorry, but if I let you finish that sentence, that would be much less impressive. Chicken pox is no big deal for kids, but it's a terrible, horrible, no-good, very bad deal for grown-ups.

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: You think Jack has chicken pox? But he doesn't have blisters. He's not itchy, and Daisy never got it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know. Again, that's why it's so impressive that I figured it out. Five percent of cases present without blisters. The kid was just a carrier. I'm gonna start you on anti-varicella gamma globulin, which will save your life. But it won't make me a hero.

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: Hey. How are you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: Like I'm not gonna die.

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: I can't wait to take you home.

utterance.speaker: Jack
utterance.content: The guys called. All this press has got us a couple of new gigs — just a few more dates, three weeks, tops.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Three weeks isn't so bad.

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: It's not three weeks. It's what he's always done — just one more tour.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Eva
utterance.content: Yeah, the pathetic thing is I let myself believe that he could change, he could be this other guy. There's nothing worse than loving someone who's never going to stop disappointing you.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Culture confirmed Jack does have chicken pox. It just took six hours longer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Autopsy works too. FYI, turns out your hero is a loser. He's going back on the road.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He still risked his life for that woman.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That was impulse. That was easy. Dealing with family is hard. Wait, that's another thing I got right. How many does that make? And how many for you? I'm also kicking your ass at gloating.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I think we should get a divorce. You have feelings for him, and I can't handle that. But it's my fault you needed someone else. I keep hurting you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We love each other.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I know. But are you happy?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Then what are we doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know, you turned out remarkably close to normal, considering the genes in play.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Here… In case your mom comes back. Happy Birthday.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes. Oh, no, I can't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's, uh, bowling night. He'll never forgive me if I don't. Oh, screw it. I'm coming.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, my chances of sex are considerably lower with Wilson. Fine.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hey. You ready?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Aah! Aah!

utterance.speaker: Dina Manzo
utterance.content: Again, this meeting is about me and setting my bounds.

utterance.speaker: Danielle Staub
utterance.content: Well, it's about me too, and I have my boundaries, Dina, and they have clearly been crossed by you and your entire family.

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: That's not true.

utterance.speaker: Danielle
utterance.content: We all need improvements, Dina, and I formed my opinion on you.

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: Shh.

utterance.speaker: Danielle
utterance.content: No, don't shush me, Dina.

utterance.speaker: Dina
utterance.content: No, I will shush you because you're not letting me finish.
